ngiemboon: Á la náʼa ńnéŋe, afʉ̀ʼʉ lepwɔ̌ʼ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ kuʼ, Samsoŋ gwoon múɔ mvfó, ńdɔg ńgʉa létsyɛʼte nzwě we. Ńkúu wó, ńgɔɔn ngie: «N ge kúu lûmndá nzwě wɔ̀ɔn.» Táʼ, tá pà nzwě we lʉʼ,
en: Later on, during the wheat harvest,   Samson took a young goat as a gift and visited his wife. “I want to go to my wife in her room,” he said. But her father would not let him enter.

ngiemboon: ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «N da kwaŋ ngie ɔ̀ la zɔɔn te yé kwoŋ, n gwɔge yé ńnáa mbwó tsɔ̌ ngàŋakwò gù we mámbàŋa. Tà ncʉ̀ʼnzèm we zɔɔn te sí ńcʉa ye wɔ́ɔ? E sẅíŋte gú ngie ɔ̀ lɔgɔ ye ńkúbe twó yé.»
en: “I was sure you hated her,” her father said, “so I gave her to one of the men who accompanied you. Isn’t her younger sister more beautiful than she is? Why not take her instead? ”

ngiemboon: Samsoŋ gɔɔn né yé ngie: Tà nyìŋ kaga wɔ́ɔn, ńtí nò tepòŋ gie n ge gÿo mbwó pʉ̀a Filisi.
en: Samson said to them, “This time I will be blameless   when I harm the Philistines.”

ngiemboon: Samsoŋ la gɔɔn púʼu, ńkẅɛ ńgʉa ńgwoon meshʉ̀shʉ̀ nkÿo tá, ńtemte menkú mɔ́b mémbʉ́a mémbʉ́a, ńgwaa kwɛɛ pɛ̌ wɔ́ɔ, éshÿɔ́gɔ nkàʼ mmɔ̌g tsetsɛ̀ɛ.
en: So he went out and caught three hundred foxes.   He took torches, turned the foxes tail-to-tail, and put a torch between each pair of tails.

ngiemboon: À la néŋ mmɔ̌g na menkàʼ ŋwɛ́, ńnyé wɔ́b pɔ́ lɔg ḿmeʼe tsɛ̀ɛ menkáʼa ngesáŋ pʉ̀a Filisi, ńtuɔ menkáʼ ngesáŋ ntsíŋ mie mé la kwɛ́te mbɔɔ gie e la nyé ńtyéte tyéte, tà mbɔɔ menkáʼa metÿǒ melùʼ lâ nkáʼa metÿǒ mevɛ́ olive.
en: Then he ignited the torches and released the foxes into the standing grain of the Philistines. He burned the piles of grain and the standing grain as well as the vineyards and olive groves.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Filisi gyá púʼu ńzɛ́te ngie: Awɔ̌ fʉ̌ʼ yɔ̀ɔn ntí nò? Mé tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Aa Samsoŋ! Ńgwɔ́ tákẅìʼ nyìŋ Timna, á nue à ka gwɔge nzwě we ńná ne nyìŋ gẅie pɔ́ Samsoŋ kɔ́ɔn ńzɔ́gɔ.» Epʉ̀a Filisi leen ńké ńgʉa ńgwoon nzwě Samsoŋ pɔ́ tá we, ńtuɔ wɔ́b pɔ́ ntʉ̀ ntʉ̀.
en: Then the Philistines asked, “Who did this? ”

ngiemboon: Samsoŋ gyá púʼu, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Páʼ pi gÿǒ pɛ́ʼɛ̀ la, n ge láʼ gwaa gɔɔn ngie m bʉ́le ńnéŋe, mbà m bʉʼʉ́ nò ŋwɛ́ gie pi gÿǒ lɛ̂.»
en: Then Samson told them, “Because you did this, I swear that I won’t rest until I have taken vengeance on you.”

ngiemboon: À la keme wɔ́b né ncù, ńzẅé pʉ̀a tà ńgyɔ́ɔn nùɔ pɔ́b. Á zába yɔɔn nò páʼɔɔn, ńdeen ńké ńcwóŋ, éshú ńdyeen shʉ̀a tóon gẅie à laa ngwòŋ Etam.
en: He tore them limb from limb   and then went down and stayed in the cave at the rock of Etam.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Filisi kwɔ́ʼ ńgʉa ńkwɛ́ lepumó sɔ́b láʼ pʉ̀a Yúndà, ḿbú ńtÿɔ́g palÿɔ́ʼncù pɔ́b tà ńkúu láʼa Leyì.
en: The Philistines went up, camped in Judah, and raided Lehi.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Yúndà gɔɔn ngie: «Mélàʼakɔ́ pi tóo ńkibte wég?» Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Peg tǒ páʼɔɔn légwoon Samsoŋ, tá à cʉa púʼu, peg lɔg ńtsɔ́ʼɔ mmó gie à ka gÿo na peg, ńná né ye.
en: So the men of Judah said, “Why have you attacked us? ”

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a Yúndà ntsáʼ tá cwóŋ, ńgʉa mvwɔ̀ʼ tóon Etam, ńgɔɔn né Samsoŋ ngie: «Tà ɔ̀ zsě ngie pʉ̀a Filisi zɔ̌ cʉ́ʼʉ sáʼa wég? Ɔ̀ gÿo lêkɔ́ lé peg lɛ̂!» Á tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó pɔ́b ngie: N tsɔʼɔ́ mmó gie pɔ́ ka gÿo na mèŋ, ńná né pɔ́b.
en: Then three thousand men of Judah went to the cave at the rock of Etam, and they asked Samson, “Don’t you realize that the Philistines rule us?   What have you done to us? ”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn mbwó ye ngie: «Peg cwǒŋ ńtó páʼɔɔn légwoon gú, ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó pʉ̀a Filisi.» Samsoŋ gɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi kʉa mvfò mèŋ ngie pi te zẅé wɔ́ɔn mɔ́.»
en: They said to him, “We’ve come to tie you up and hand you over to the Philistines.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó ye ngie: «Ngǎŋ! Peg faʼa pɔ́ ndàʼ lékwɛ́ɛ gú, ńgʉa ńnáa mbwó pɔ́b. Peg těen ńgee zẅé gú wɔ́.» Pɔ́ la leen ńké ńkwɛ́ɛ yé né menkÿo sẅé mémbʉ́a, éfó mvwɔ̀ʼ tóon ńkẅile yé.
en: “No,” they said,   “we won’t kill you, but we will tie you up securely and hand you over to them.” So they tied him up with two new ropes  # 15:13 Jdg 16:11–12 and led him away from the rock.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la leen ńgʉa tà ńkúu Leyì, epʉ̀a Filisi gwaa tó záʼa yé, ńgiŋe ńnáa lepìi. Azẅìge Cʉ̀apʉ̀a sẅɛ́ʼ ńkúu na Samsoŋ: Menkÿo mie mé ně ńdɔg ńkwɛ́ mbwó mé cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ páʼ mmó nzsǒ gie mmɔ̌g tǔɔ; éfó mbwó yé ńkeme ḿbʉle ssé.
en: When he came to Lehi, the Philistines came to meet him shouting. The Spirit of the Lord came powerfully on him, and the ropes that were on his arms and wrists became like burnt flax and fell off.

ngiemboon: Á gyá kẅǐ gága nzikáasè tà metse nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mǒ, á náa pwó ńkwɔ́b, ńdɔg ńzẅé pʉ̀a tàʼ ntsáʼ.
en: He found a fresh jawbone of a donkey, reached out his hand, took it, and killed a thousand men with it.

ngiemboon: Samsoŋ gɔɔn ngie:
en: Then Samson said:

ngiemboon: À la gɔɔn nò tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, ńgwáʼa kẅǐ gága nzikáasè ŋwɛ́; mé tsẅi lezíŋ jʉʼó lê Lamad-Leyii, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie (lekwɔʼɔ́-kẅǐ gága nzikáasè.)
en: When he finished speaking, he threw away the jawbone and named that place Jawbone Hill.

ngiemboon: Agága yé la shÿó shÿǒ, tà á gaʼte ńtóŋo Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Gù zɔ ka lɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn gẅie n gee ngàŋafàʼ gù, éfaʼa wɔɔn máamáa fàʼ. Ɔ̀ ge piŋ gÿo, n kwé nzyè ntse fʉ̀ʼɔɔn tà pʉ̀a pie mé la te wɔ́b púʼ gwoon wɔ́ɔn la?»
en: He became very thirsty and called out to the Lord, “You have accomplished this great victory through your servant. Must I now die of thirst and fall into the hands of the uncircumcised? ”

ngiemboon: E Ssé zẅɛʼɛ tóon gẅie aa Leyì, ntse kẅɛ. Samsoŋ nú, mbùm ye piŋe. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo mé tóŋo yɛ̌ sáʼa ntse lê «Eyiŋ-Kole», á lɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Sáʼa ntse nyìŋ gẅie à toŋó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.» Asaʼá ntse ŋwɛ́ ké nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ Leyì tà ńkúu lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: So God split a hollow place in the ground at Lehi, and water came out of it. After Samson drank, his strength returned, and he revived.   That is why he named it Hakkore Spring,  # 15:19 = Spring of the One Who Cried Out which is still in Lehi today.

ngiemboon: Samsoŋ la sáʼ ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ na ngùʼ móm mbʉ́a na fʉ̀ʼ ye pʉ̀a Filisi.
en: And he judged Israel twenty years in the days of the Philistines.
